Pu Yi, the last Emperor of China, assumes the throne.
The 1908 Messina earthquake in southern Italy, magnitude 7.1, kills 70,000 people.
William Howard Taft is inaugurated as President of the United States; deep divisions in his Republican Party over tariffs.
Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909 signed (effective on July 9).
Indian Councils Act passed.
Robert E. Peary claims to have reached the North Pole though the claim is subsequently heavily contested.
A countercoup fails in the Ottoman Empire.
A revolution forces Mohammad Ali Shah, Persian Shah of the Qajar dynasty to abdicate in favor of his son Ahmad Shah Qajar.
Boy Scouts of America is founded.
George V becomes King of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions and Emperor of India upon the death of Edward VII.
Union of South Africa created.
Kingdom of Montenegro is proclaimed independent.
Imperial Japan annexes Korea.
The 5 October 1910 revolution in Portugal and proclamation of the First Portuguese Republic.
Beginning of the Mexican Revolution (Plan of San Luis Potosí).
Roald Amundsen first reaches the South Pole.
Eugene B. Ely lands on the deck of the USS Pennsylvania stationed in San Francisco harbor, marking the first time an aircraft lands on a ship.
Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire in New York City results in the deaths of 146 workers and leads to sweeping workplace safety reforms.
The Italo-Turkish war which led to the capture of Libya by Italy, begins.
Xinhai Revolution, which overthrew the Qing dynasty of China, begins.
Swiss race car driver and automotive engineer Louis Chevrolet co-founds the Chevrolet Motor Company in Detroit with his brother Arthur Chevrolet, William C. Durant and others.
New Delhi becomes the capital of British India.
The African National Congress is founded.
End of the Chinese Empire. Republic of China established.
Arizona becomes the last state to be admitted to the continental Union.
Morocco becomes a protectorate of France.
Sinking of the RMS Titanic.
Emperor Meiji dies, ending the Meiji Era; his son, the Emperor Taishō, becomes Emperor of Japan.
The Kuomintang, the Chinese nationalist party, is founded.
The First Balkan War begins.
In the 1913 Ottoman coup d'état, Ismail Enver comes to power.
Woodrow Wilson is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Igor Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring infamously premiers in Paris.
Treaty of London.
Treaty of Bucharest.
Ford Motor Company introduces the first moving assembly line.
The Federal Reserve System is created.
Gavrilo Princip assassinates Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in Sarajevo, triggering the start of World War I.
World War I begins.
Panama Canal opens.
Martha, last known passenger pigeon, dies.
Benedict XV becomes Pope.
The United Kingdom establishes the Sultanate of Egypt as a protectorate.
The Christmas truce is celebrated by the Germans and the British along the Western Front.
Second Battle of Ypres begins, first widespread use of poison gas.
The deportation of Armenian leaders and notables in Constantinople signals the onset of the Armenian Genocide.
Sinking of the RMS Lusitania.
In the Banana Wars, the United States occupation of Haiti begins.
The Allies Gallipoli Campaign ends in failure; heavy losses of Australian troops.
The first nationwide implementation of daylight saving time in the German Empire and Austria-Hungary.
The Warlord Era begins in China after the death of Yuan Shikai.
Liberal David Lloyd George becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Grigori Rasputin is assassinated in Russia.
Russian Revolution ends the Russian Empire; beginning of Russian Civil War.
USA joins the Entente for the last 17 months of World War I.
The first Pulitzer Prizes announced.
October Revolution in Russia.
The Ukrainian–Soviet War begins.
The National Hockey League is formed in Montreal, Canada.
Independence of Finland.
Ukraine declares independence from Russia.
Belarus declares independence from Russia.
The Armenian–Azerbaijani War begins.
Azerbaijan Democratic Republic declared.
Mehmed VI becomes the last Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and the last Caliph.
German Revolution begins.
Abdication of Kaiser Wilhelm II.
The Kingdom of Iceland, a personal union with Denmark, is formed.
The First Red Scare in the United States. Irish War of Independence begins.
Polish-Soviet War.
Comintern established in the Kremlin to coordinate Communist parties worldwide.
The International Labour Organization is established.

The Jallianwala Bagh massacre in northern India: Acting Brigadier-General Reginald Dyer orders troops of the British Indian Army to fire their rifles into a crowd of unarmed Indian civilians, killing from 379 to 1,000 people and injuring another 1,500.
Turkish War of Independence begins.
The Treaty of Versailles redraws European borders.
End of Polish–Ukrainian War.
German Revolution ends with the collapse of the German Empire and the establishment of the Weimar Republic.
Release date of Feline Follies, the first appearance of Felix the Cat (then known as Master Tom).
League of Nations founded.
Prohibition in the United States begins.
Victory for Estonia in the Estonian War of Independence.
Mandatory Palestine established.
The Mexican Revolution ends.
Mahatma Gandhi launches Non-cooperation movement.
Premiere of the science-fiction play R.U.R. (Rossum's Universal Robots), in which the word 'robot' was first used.
Warren G. Harding is inaugurated as President of the United States.
Adolf Hitler becomes Führer of the Nazi Party as hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic begins.
End of the Polish-Soviet War.
The Italian National Fascist Party is established by Benito Mussolini.
End of the Ukrainian–Soviet War.
Coup brings the Pahlavi dynasty to power in Iran.
James Joyce publishes Ulysses.
Egypt gains independence from the United Kingdom, though British forces still occupy the Suez Canal.
End of Russian Civil War.
The Irish Civil War begins.
Conservative Bonar Law becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
March on Rome brings Benito Mussolini to power in Italy.
Ottoman Sultanate abolished by the Turkish Grand National Assembly; Sultan Mehmed VI is deposed.
Howard Carter discovers Tutankhamen's tomb.
British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) established.
Irish Free State is established, while the Province of Northern Ireland is created within The United Kingdom.
Gabriel Narutowicz, President of Poland, is assassinated.
The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR), the world's first officially Communist state, is formed.
Time Magazine is first published.
Stanley Baldwin becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
The Irish Civil War ends.
A military coup ousts and kills Bulgarian Prime Minister Aleksandar Stamboliyski.
Death of Warren G. Harding; Vice President Calvin Coolidge assumes office as President of the United States.
The Great Kantō earthquake kills at least 105,000 people in Japan.
Turkish War of Independence ends; Ankara replaces Istanbul as its capital.
Kemal Atatürk becomes the first President of the newly established Republic of Turkey.
The Walt Disney Company is founded.
The Beer Hall Putsch, an attempt to overthrow the Weimar Republic, ends in failure and brief imprisonment for Adolf Hitler but brings the Nazi Party to national attention.
Hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic ends with the introduction of the Rentenmark.
The death of Vladimir Lenin triggers power struggle between Leon Trotsky and Joseph Stalin.
Ramsay MacDonald becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom; first Labour Party prime minister.
Rhapsody in Blue by George Gershwin premieres in New York City.
The Caliphate is abolished by Kemal Atatürk.
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation founded under J. Edgar Hoover.
Immigration Act of 1924 significantly restricts immigration from Asia, the Middle East, and Southern Europe to USA.
The August Uprising in Georgia against Soviet rule.
Conservative Stanley Baldwin becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Benito Mussolini delivers a speech to begin his dictatorship.
Hitler's Mein Kampf is published.
28 May 1926 coup d'état in Portugal.
National Broadcasting Company (NBC) founded in New York City.
General Georgios Kondylis overthrows General Theodoros Pangalos in Greece.
Emperor Taishō dies; his son, the Emperor Shōwa (Hirohito) becomes Emperor of Japan.
The BBC is granted a Royal Charter in the United Kingdom.
The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland officially becomes the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
The Bath School disaster, a series of violent attacks by Andrew Kehoe results in 45 deaths in Michigan, USA.
Saudi Arabia gains independence.
The Chinese Civil War begins.
Columbia Broadcasting System (CBS) founded in New York City.
Mount Rushmore construction begins in South Dakota, U.S.
The Jazz Singer, the first 'talkie', is released.
Soviet general secretary Joseph Stalin becomes dictator of the Soviet Union.
King Zog I is crowned in Albania.
Accidental rediscovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming.
The Kellogg-Briand Pact is signed in Paris.
Steamboat Willie, is the first appearance of Mickey Mouse.
The Warlord Era ends in China.
Pope Pius XI signs the Lateran Treaty with Italian leader Benito Mussolini, after which the Vatican City is recognised as a sovereign state.
Saint Valentine's Day Massacre, the murder of seven members and associates of Chicago's North Side Gang.
Herbert Hoover is inaugurated as President of the United States.
The first Academy Awards are presented.
Ramsay MacDonald becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Clyde Tombaugh discovers Pluto.
Salt March by Mohandas Gandhi and the official start of civil disobedience in British India.
Haile Selassie becomes Emperor of Abyssinia.
Sinkin' in the Bathtub, the first Looney Tunes short, is released.
Construction of Chrysler Building completed.
King Kullen, widely regarded as the first supermarket, opens in Queens, New York City.
Aided by the Great Depression, the Nazi Party increases its share of the vote from 2.6% to 18.3%.
The Vargas Era begins in Brazil.
Vatican Radio first began broadcasting.
'The Star-Spangled Banner' is adopted as the United States's national anthem.
Empire State Building completed.
The Second Spanish Republic is declared.
The Chinese Soviet Republic is proclaimed by Mao Zedong.
Christ the Redeemer completed.
Lindbergh baby kidnapping.
Éamon de Valera becomes President of the Executive Council (prime minister) of the Irish Free State.
Military coup in Chile.
Siamese Revolution establishes a constitutional monarchy.
The Chaco War between Bolivia and Paraguay begins.
BBC World Service starts broadcasting.
Adolf Hitler becomes Chancellor of Germany.
King Kong is released in New York.
Franklin D. Roosevelt is inaugurated as President of the United States, after being elected to the first of his record four terms.
Japan announces it will leave the League of Nations.

Germany announces its withdrawal from the League of Nations and the World Disarmament Conference, after the U.S., the U.K. and France deny its request to increase its defense armaments under the Versailles Treaty.
Prohibition in the United States is abolished.
The United States grants more autonomy to the Philippines.
Bonnie and Clyde are shot to death in a police ambush.
John Dillinger is gunned down by the FBI outside the Biograph Theater.
The United States occupation of Haiti ends.
With the death of President Hindenburg, Hitler declares himself Führer of Germany.
Mao Zedong begins the Long March.
Establishment of 20th Century Fox.
Reza Shah of Iran asks the international community to formally adopt the name 'Iran' to refer to the country, instead of the name 'Persia'.
Chaco War ends.
Enactment of the Nuremberg racial laws.
The Second Italo-Abyssinian War begins and goes until February 1937. It includes events such as the exile of Haile Selassie and the conquest of Abyssinia by Benito Mussolini.
Edward VIII becomes King of the British Commonwealth and Emperor of India.
Italy annexes Ethiopia.
Beginning of the Spanish Civil War.
'Benjamin', the last known thylacine, dies in Hobart Zoo.
Boy Scouts of the Philippines is founded.
After a reign shorter than one year, Edward VIII abdicates and hands the throne to his brother, George VI.
German zeppelin Hindenburg crashes in Lakehurst, New Jersey, ending the airship era.
Neville Chamberlain becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
Japanese invasion of China, and the beginning of World War II in the Far East.
Toyota founded in Japan by Kiichiro Toyoda.

The World Health Organization endorses the first malaria vaccine.
Journalists Maria Ressa of the Philippines and Dmitry Muratov of Russia are awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
Colombia's most wanted drug lord, Dario Antonio Úsuga, whose Gulf Clan controls many smuggling routes into the US and other countries, is captured by Colombia's armed forces.
SpaceX launches the Crew-3 mission, carrying four Expedition 66 crew members to the International Space Station.
Russia draws international condemnation following an anti-satellite weapon test that creates a cloud of space debris, threatening the International Space Station.
Barbados becomes a republic on its 55th anniversary of independence while remaining a member of the Commonwealth of Nations.
Gabriel Boric is elected as President of Chile.
Bloody January in Kazakhstan.

The Hunga Tonga–Hunga Haʻapai eruption and tsunami is the largest and most powerful volcanic eruption in decades, and the largest explosion ever recorded by modern instruments.
Russia invades Ukraine, escalating the Russo-Ukrainian War, causing a refugee crisis and tens of thousands of deaths on both sides.
WHL0137-LS 'Earendel' imaged by Hubble Space Telescope, the earliest and most distant known star.
Elon Musk purchases Twitter.
Kane Tanaka, the second oldest verified person to have ever lived, dies at the age of 119.
Monkeypox outbreak.
Sagittarius A*, supermassive black hole at Galactic Center, imaged by Event Horizon Telescope.
Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization.
Ketanji Brown Jackson becomes the first black woman on the Supreme Court.
Assassination of Shinzo Abe.
James Webb Space Telescope takes Webb's First Deep Field, oldest and highest resolution image of the universe to date.
Chinese paddlefish declared extinct.
China conducts its largest ever military exercise around Taiwan in response to a controversial visit by Nancy Pelosi.
'Man of the Hole', reclusive indigenous Brazilian and last of his ethnicity, dies.
Floods in Pakistan.
UN Human Rights Office report on Xinjiang.
Elizabeth II dies at the age of 96, and is succeeded by Charles III.
Mahsa Amini protests.
Eliud Kipchoge sets marathon world record at Berlin.
Double Asteroid Redirection Test demonstrates capabilities on asteroid (65803) Didymos I Dimorphos.
Giorgia Meloni becomes Prime Minister of Italy.
Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva is elected President of Brazil.
Ethiopia–Tigray peace agreement.
The FTX cryptocurrency exchange files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
The world population is estimated to have reached 8 billion.
NASA launches Artemis 1, the first uncrewed mission of its Space Launch System, the most powerful rocket ever to reach orbit.
COVID-19 protests in China.
OpenAI launched ChatGPT, an AI chatbot.
Self-coup attempt, impeachment and arrest of Pedro Castillo sparks protests in Peru.
Qatar corruption scandal at the European Parliament.
Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, who served from 2005 until his resignation in 2013, dies at the age of 95.
